weka.clusterers

Class LFCluster.Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.clusterers.LFCluster.Grid
  • Enclosing class:
    LFCluster

    protected class LFCluster.Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    The grid object where the LFCluster.GridInstance objects are placed and the ants run to cluster these GridInstance objects.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected LFCluster.Coordinate[] gridInstances
      An association of LFCluster.GridInstance object indexes to positions, to answer the question where a GridInstance is without checking each position of the surface until the GridInstance is found.
      protected int[][] surface
      The surface of the grid as an array, where the LFCluster.GridInstance are placed.
      protected int xSize
      Size of the grid in the x dimension measured in number of grid cells.
      protected int ySize
      Size of the grid in the y dimension measured in number of grid cells.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid(int x, int y, int gridInstanceCapacity)
      Constructs a new grid.

    • Method Summary

      Drops the given gridInstance to the position on the grid.

      Returns a Instances object, containing DenseInstance objects to make the GridInstances on the grid accessible for a Clusterer.

      Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the bottom border of the grid.

      Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the top border of the grid.

      Returns a random position on the grid, that can take a LFCluster.GridInstance.

      Returns a random position on the grid, that holds a LFCluster.GridInstance.

      Tells if the given LFCluster.Coordinate is available for storing a LFCluster.GridInstance on the grid.

      Tells if the given LFCluster.Coordinate on the grid currently holds a LFCluster.GridInstance object.

      Tells if a given LFCluster.Coordinate is a valid position on this grid.

    • Field Detail

      • xSize

        protected int xSize
        Size of the grid in the x dimension measured in number of grid cells.

      • ySize

        protected int ySize
        Size of the grid in the y dimension measured in number of grid cells.

      • surface

        protected int[][] surface
        The surface of the grid as an array, where the LFCluster.GridInstance are placed. The two dimensions of the array represent the two grid dimensions, where the first one is the x dimension.

      • gridInstances

        protected LFCluster.Coordinate[] gridInstances
        An association of LFCluster.GridInstance object indexes to positions, to answer the question where a GridInstance is without checking each position of the surface until the GridInstance is found.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int x,
            int y,
            int gridInstanceCapacity)
        Constructs a new grid.
        Parameters:
        x - size of the grid in the x dimension.
        y - size of the grid in the y dimension.
        gridInstanceCapacity - how many LFCluster.GridInstance objects are stored on this grid.

    • Method Detail

      • positionIsValid

        public boolean positionIsValid(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells if a given LFCluster.Coordinate is a valid position on this grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to be checked
        Returns:
        true if position is an addressable position, false otherwise.

      • positionHasFreeStorage

        public boolean positionHasFreeStorage(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells if the given LFCluster.Coordinate is available for storing a LFCluster.GridInstance on the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to be checked
        Returns:
        true, if a GridInstance can be stored at position, false if there is already a GridInstance or the position is not on the grid.

      • positionHasGridInstance

        public boolean positionHasGridInstance(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells if the given LFCluster.Coordinate on the grid currently holds a LFCluster.GridInstance object.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to be checked
        Returns:
        true, if a position is on the grid and holds a GridInstance object, false otherwise.

      • getDistanceToTopBorder

        public int getDistanceToTopBorder(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the top border of the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the LFCluster.Coordinate for the measurement
        Returns:
        grid cell count between position and the top grid border.

      • getDistanceToBottomBorder

        public int getDistanceToBottomBorder(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the bottom border of the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the LFCluster.Coordinate for the measurement
        Returns:
        grid cell count between position and the bottom grid border.

      • getDistanceToLeftBorder

        public int getDistanceToLeftBorder(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the left border of the grid.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        grid cell count between position and the left grid border.

      • getDistanceToRightBorder

        public int getDistanceToRightBorder(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells how many grid cells are between the given position and the right border of the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the LFCluster.Coordinate for the measurement
        Returns:
        grid cell count between position and the right grid border.

      • previewGridInstance

        public LFCluster.GridInstance previewGridInstance(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Returns the LFCluster.GridInstance at the given position, but does not pick up the GridInstance from the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - Coordinate from where to preview the GridInstance
        Returns:
        the GridInstance at this position or null if no proper access to the GridInstance was possible.

      • doGridInstancePick

        protected final LFCluster.GridInstance doGridInstancePick(int x,
                                                          int y)
        Pick up the LFCluster.GridInstance from the given position.

        The parameters are chosen like that to keep the method body small. In parallel access this method must be likely locked, so a smaller method body can lead to a faster unlock. Disadvantage is that the parameters are not consistent among other methods of this class. The parameters must have been validated before, this method omits the check. The check is done by #pickGridInstance(Coordinate).

        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the position from where to pick up a GridInstance.
        y - y coordinate of the position from where to pick up a GridInstance.
        Returns:
        the picked up GridInstance.
        See Also:
        #pickGridInstance(Coordinate)

      • pickGridInstance

        public LFCluster.GridInstance pickGridInstance(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Tells the grid to return the LFCluster.GridInstance of the given position and to remove it from there.

        This method mainly checks the given parameters and then calls the protected method doGridInstancePick(int, int), which executes the actual pick up process.

        Parameters:
        position - position on the grid from where to get the GridInstance.
        Returns:
        the GridInstance from position or null on failure.
        See Also:
        doGridInstancePick(int, int)

      • doGridInstanceDrop

        protected final boolean doGridInstanceDrop(int index,
                                           LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Drops the LFCluster.GridInstance to the given position.

        The parameters are chosen like that to keep the method body small. In parallel access this method must be likely locked, so a smaller method body can lead to a faster unlock. Disadvantage is that the parameters are not consistent among other methods of this class. The parameters must have been validated before, this method omits the check. The check is done by #dropGridInstance(GridInstance, Coordinate).

        Parameters:
        index - index of the GridInstance to drop
        position - where to drop the GridInstance with index index.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        #dropGridInstance(GridInstance, Coordinate)

      • dropGridInstance

        public boolean dropGridInstance(LFCluster.GridInstance gridInstance,
                                LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Drops the given gridInstance to the position on the grid.

        This method mainly checks the given parameters and then calls the protected method #doGridInstanceDrop(int, Coordinate), which executes the actual drop down process.

        Parameters:
        gridInstance - the GridInstance to be dropped to the grid.
        position - where to drop the gridInstance on the grid.
        Returns:
        true, if the gridInstance was dropped successfully. False, if the gridInstance was not dropped for any reason.
        See Also:
        #doGridInstanceDrop(int, Coordinate)

      • getRandomGridInstancePosition

        public LFCluster.Coordinate getRandomGridInstancePosition()
        Returns a random position on the grid, that holds a LFCluster.GridInstance.
        Returns:
        LFCluster.Coordinate of a position on the grid that holds a GridInstance.

      • getRandomFreePosition

        public LFCluster.Coordinate getRandomFreePosition()
        Returns a random position on the grid, that can take a LFCluster.GridInstance.
        Returns:
        LFCluster.Coordinate of a position on the grid that holds no GridInstance.

      • getAllGridInstancesAsDenseInstances

        public weka.core.Instances getAllGridInstancesAsDenseInstances()
        Returns a Instances object, containing DenseInstance objects to make the GridInstances on the grid accessible for a Clusterer.

        These Instances can be clustered by any Clusterer.

        Returns:
        an Instances object containing the GridInstances casted to DenseInstance objects.
